###  Exercise 7.25: Can Screen safely rely on the default versions of copy and assignment? If so, why? If not, why not?    we can safely rely on default versions of copy and assignment constructors as we have used the string library class to    store the contents, which have its own copy and assignment constructors,     when screen object is copied or assigned, string class will take care of copy and assignment of its data,    and similarly for destroying objects     Unless the class manages dynamic memory, we can use default
